data.title: [feature request]: Track file position navigation history
data.body:
Full Visual Studio has a nice feature where the file position navigation history is tracked, such that if we go to a particular position in any file (eg. From a "Go to definition" command), we can go back to the previous position by pressing `Ctrl--` and going forward again by pressing `Ctrl-+`

Having this in vscode would be valuable as we can easily preserve our mental editing context by being able to easily switch to various file locations back and forth.

data.title: [css] CSS variables should offer same support as SASS/LESS variables
Intelisense for "import" statements
data.body:
Hello, is it possible to add intellisense for import statements? Either disaply all files in the project that match the pattern relative to the current file, or display whatever is in the path.

E.g. 

"../" + ctr+space  will pop whatever is in the parent directory 
"my" + ctrl + space will pop up all files that contain "my" showing path relative to the currrent file

![screen shot 2016-02-16 at 10 22 07 pm](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/979966/13076130/ec22f070-d4fb-11e5-9c3b-1a300c12b4e4.png)

data.title: Jsdoc tooltip showing raw tags
data.body:
The tooltip is showing all the jsdoc information except for the `@param` tags.
Eg. jsdoc:

``` javascript
/**
 * Filters a path based on a regexp or glob pattern.
 * @param {String} basePath The base path where the search will be performed.
 * @param {String} pattern A string defining a regexp of a glob pattern.
 * @param {String} type The search pattern type, can be a regexp or a glob.
 * @param {Object} options A object containing options to the search.
 * @return {Array} A list containing the filtered paths.
 */
function pathFilter(basePath, pattern, type, options){
//...
}
```

The tooltip shows like this:
![Tooltip](http://imgh.us/error_18.png)

I'm using the january version without Salsa enabled.

data.title: can't open multiple folder in same window
data.body: It's kind of feature request. Please add support for multiple folder open on same window. It's really essential.

data.title: running vscode with gksudo or sudo permission
data.body:
visual studio not starting up when running it with gksudo or sudo permission on my Arch Linux. The window just got hanged every time. Starting normally works.

Can not save a file whose owner is root, Gives EACCESS_PERMISSION error. In case of other editors, saving the same file invoking gksudo automatically.

data.title: "Add to Watch" should be available while not debugging
data.body: It would be nice to have the ability to add expression to the "Watch" debug pane even while not debugging. Right now the right-click context menu doesn't have this action when not debugging.

data.title: When the "Watch" debug pane is empty there is no watermark and no action on hover
data.body:
When the debug pane "Watch" doesn't have any expressions in it, there is no watermark text telling the user that expressions can be added to this pane. As a result the user is not sure how this pane is different to the "Variables" debug pane.

Related to this, when you hover your mouse over the "Watch" debug pane nothing happens. You have to hover over the title of the pane in order to make the "Add Expression" button visible.

data.title: Variable names in comments are inspectable while debugging

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
Words that coincide with variable / object names in comments are inspectable as if you were inspecting the real variable. For me this occurred in a JavaScript file on Windows 10.

![debug_commented_variables](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/14299377/13093842/38301a82-d4bc-11e5-85db-e62d90f676a2.gif)

data.title: Close default settings and keyboard bindings when closing user's settings file.
data.body:
1) cmd+, to show the side-by-side of the default and user settings
2) cmd+w closes the user settings
3) the default settings pane is now full width
4) cmd+w then shows "There is currently no file opened to close"

You have to click the close glyph or select a file to get rid of the default settings. 

Is this by design? I would think step 2 should close both panes since you can't do anything directly to the default settings anyway.

data.title: Autocomplete with CTRL+SPACE after . does not work
Provide an option to stop scrolling revealing active file in explorer
data.body: I would love to see a user option to disable this feature; it really is a hassle when comparing across multiple files in large projects.

data.title: Can we have something like Visual Studio's Browserlink in vscode ?
data.body: Maybe through a extension  ? Would be a great feature in vscode.

data.title: 'registerOnTypeFormattingEditProvider' subscription does not work
onCommand activation does not work as expected for debugging command
data.body:
When activating an extension using onCommand activation, the activation is not triggered when using the mouse or the command palette.

Repro (vscode 0.10.8)
1. Create an extension (mine was initially created with yo code generator). Add the following activation:
   `"activationEvents": [
   "onCommand:workbench.action.debug.start"
   ],`
2. Start a debug session (e.g. using mock debugger). When starting the debug session, click the play button or run Debug:Start from the command palette.

The extension is not activated as expected. Note that pressing F5 will activate the extension.

- [x]  Read the contents of the text editor (Windows & NVDA only)

data.title: Command to open specified file from opened folder for editing
data.body:
While working with large flat folders it would be nice to be able to type the first few letters of a filename and see a list of files that match for quick opening. Maybe a `File: Edit File...` command that displays a list of files that match the typed name, similar to <kbd>CTRL</kbd>-<kbd>Tab</kbd> maybe?

Scrolling to the file can take awhile and feels clunky and if the folder structure is large enough it is easy to fly right past the file you are looking for.

data.title: Context menu not shown on surface pro 4
data.body:
This is an usability issue. I am using Surface pro 4 tablet, windows 10 x64, vscode 0.10.8.

As a source code reviewer, I'd like to go to the definition from a source code line, without the need of keyboard or tablet pen.

Normally, if you want to right click on "my Computer" or "Desktop" or anywhere, you can just put your finger on the tablet screen and hold there for 3 seconds, the context menu will pop up.
However, in vscode, I put my finger right in javascript source code viewlet and hold it for several seconds and nothing happens. As a result, if user want to navigate to definition, or 'Go to symbol', he/she needs to click the system menu on right-left side of vscode, or, use a keyboard, which both are annoying if you are using a tablet which usually no keyboard no pen support - you can only use a finger to touch.

Please see: https://github.com/TheLevenCreations/electron_typescript_template/blob/master/captured2.gif

data.title: é character showing up as ? in text files
data.body: When I open a text file containing the é special character it shows up as a ? with a white diamond around it.

data.title: any shortcuts for multi selections?
data.body: For example, I want to change a variable name which is used in multiple places in one file, so, I want to select all of them by selecting one of them and enter shortcut to select the others as well, just wonder whether by default code has such shortcut? I only find an action named `editor.action.addSelectionToNextFindMatch`, which actually only adds one selection

data.title: tasks.json not present in File menu
data.body: While I can easily find `Workspace Settings` and `Keyboard Shortcuts` from the _File_ menu. I have manually open tasks.json in my `.vscode` directory.

data.title: The clean all button in the changes header of the git tab does not behave as expected.
data.body:
Pressing the clean all button (Designed to look like an undo button) removes all untracked files and folders as it calls _git clean -fd_
We would expect it to clean only the files shown in the changes list.
We think this was how it use to work with an older version of vscode.

Thanks.
